item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 1, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Advent of Code 2024 (143 points | 48 comments)
2. DynaSaur: Large Language Agents Beyond Predefined Actions (51 points | 11 comments)
3. Ntfs2btrfs does in-place conversion of NTFS filesystem to the open-source Btrfs (302 points | 109 comments)
4. Show HN: Open-source private home security camera system (end-to-end encryption) (231 points | 67 comments)
5. AMD Disables Zen 4's Loop Buffer (221 points | 73 comments)
6. WinDepends – A Rewrite of the Dependency Walker (92 points | 13 comments)
7. Ask HN: Recommend me some silent movies (24 points | 29 comments)
8. The Slang Shading Language (72 points | 7 comments)
9. Geometric line-art of Wacław Szpakowski (2017) (399 points | 46 comments)
10. Thoughts on the Software Industry (2022) (54 points | 35 comments)
11. Safe relational database queries using the Rust type system (219 points | 126 comments)
12. Education and Healthcare Suck for the Same Reasons (85 points | 78 comments)
13. SigNoz (YC W21) Is Hiring Open Source Community Engineer (Remote) (IN/EU) ( | hide)
14. Exploring and having fun with rotary telephones (34 points | 21 comments)
15. What does this button do? – My new car has a mysterious and undocumented switch (648 points | 461 comments)
16. The Opposite of Documentation is Superstition (2020) (96 points | 46 comments)
17. Square Roots and Maxima (97 points | 29 comments)
18. Engineering Sleep (394 points | 166 comments)
19. Motivating Personal Growth by Seeking Discomfort (2022) (49 points | 36 comments)
20. Caving scientists exploring the darkest places on Earth (42 points | 13 comments)
21. Make the most of your burl (93 points | 33 comments)
22. Canon ships its first nanoprint lithography machine, rivals ASML (46 points | 13 comments)
23. Sol-Ark manufacturer reportedly disables all Deye inverters in the US (261 points | 234 comments)
24. Interview of Robert Shingledecker, Tiny Core Linux and DSL Developer (2009) (73 points | 28 comments)
25. DELETEs Are Difficult (51 points | 41 comments)
26. Show HN: Jinbase – Multi-model transactional embedded database (27 points | discuss)
27. Nodezator is a generalist Python node editor (190 points | 71 comments)
28. Large Language Models as Markov Chains (10 points | 1 comment)
29. Honeycrisp apples went from marvel to mediocre (267 points | 243 comments)
30. The Influence of Bell Labs (219 points | 128 comments)
